reviews.text: I bought the Senegalese Dibi from here. It was really good. I love the fact that they included the mustard sauce in it. Thank you!

We stumbled on this place your local home-cooked. The food is great. They just need to get more organized. We came there with friends raving about the food place our orders and they came back stating they ran out. We had to wait. It was late on a Saturday. If you‚Äôre going there go early before they run out of food.

Best Senegalese restaurant in the Bronx. The only other place to get authentic Senegalese food is 116th street, and everything else in The Bronx is fusion style restaurants. If you want to feel like your eating Dibi on the beach in Yoff, this is the place too be

Horrible customer service and disorganization. The food is just okay, the lamb is old and dry. They change their prices according to if you are known to them (preferably African), and how much they think they can get off you.
Food is mad good

The food is delicious however they don't seem to have a large variety to choose from even tho they have a menu. Unless they didn't want to serve to me because I wasn't of their culture. This was hinted a  based on the different language they used while laughing at me while I waited for my order.  and the fake " Sister" as my bag was handed to me. This is my second time going in four years and they didn't have a any peanut stews.

Robbers! I ordered dibi chicken with brown rice. The cost is $22 according to the menu. The server proceeded to charge me $27.18. According to him, the new price (not shown on the menu) is $24 if I were paying cash, and $26 because I am paying with a card plus an additional $1.18 for the grand $27.18 total. I'm so upset, but I wanted the food for my daughter, so I just purchased it and left.
The food is good. You can order and pick up. They also deliver. They also have their own drinks ginger and sorrel juice.
